definition: to squash/to crush/to squeeze out of business/to drive out
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
to collapse/to break or wear down/to defeat

sentences.english: A company that gets software written faster and better will, all other things being equal, put its competitors out of business.
sentences.chinese: 其他条件相同，软件写的又快又好公司会把对手挤垮。

sentences.english: The volume of rose imports has already crushed some domestic growers.
sentences.chinese: 大量的进口玫瑰已经挤垮了国内一些种植商。

sentences.english: They were beaten, and battered, in their Week 2 loss to the 49ers.
sentences.chinese: 在第二周对阵49人时他们被击败，并挤垮。

sentences.english: Competition has forced out many small firms.
sentences.chinese: 竞争挤垮了许多小公司。

sentences.english: Small shop is freezed out by the big supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 小商店都要让大超级市场给挤垮了。

sentences.english: The firm needs boosting up, if it is not to be defeated by its competitors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司如要在竞争中不被对手挤垮，就需加强实力。

sentences.english: The tide of self-published books threatens to swamp their products.
sentences.chinese: 而私人出版作品的潮流也正威胁着要挤垮他们的书籍。

definition: to close down a business for good and put the best face on it (idiom)
to undercut competitors/to hustle/to compete for business
to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to build up an enterprise through painstaking efforts
